name: Arctic Fox
description: The Arctic fox is a small, white fox that is native to the Arctic regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It has a thick coat of fur that helps it survive in cold temperatures.
location: Arctic regions of the Northern Hemisphere

name: Fennec Fox
description: The fennec fox is a small nocturnal fox found in the Sahara of North Africa. It has large ears to dissipate heat and sand, and can survive without drinking water for long periods of time.

name: Red Fox
description: The red fox is the largest of the true foxes and is found throughout most of the world. It has a distinctive red coat and is known for its cunning and intelligence.

name: Gray Fox
description: The gray fox is a small, omnivorous fox that is found in North and Central America. It has a distinctive gray coat and is known for its ability to climb trees.

name: Kit Fox
description: The kit fox is a small fox found in the southwestern United States and Mexico. It has large ears for thermal regulation and is able to live in very arid environments.

name: Swift Fox
description: The swift fox is a small fox found in the western United States and Canada. It has long legs for running and is able to run at speeds up to 50 km/h.

name: Corsac Fox
description: The corsac fox is a medium-sized fox found in central Asia. It has a grayish-yellow coat and is known for its adaptability to various environments.

name: Cape Fox
description: The cape fox is a small fox found in southern Africa. It has a distinctive black stripe running down its tail and is known for its nocturnal behavior.
